alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 11 at 7:02PM CDT until April 11 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 702 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Tushka, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Atoka, Tushka, Lane and McGee Creek Lake. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
